result.execSummary:
The defendant Samuel P Silver was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.
  • Possess w/Intent-Heroin (<=3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(d)1.
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
AS TO ALL COUNTS: Provide a DNA sample; pay related surcharge. Pay court costs and victim/witness surcharges by 07-24-17; non-payment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
- Restitution is set at zero.

COURT DOES NOT FIND THE DEFENDANT ELIGIBLE FOR EXPUNCTION
Concurrent with: Any other sentence; AS TO EACH COUNT, with credit for 79 days time served. Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for AODA treatment. Court makes the defendant eligible for the Day Reporting Center, and takes no position on electronic monitoring.

- No Contact with MM during the pendency of this sentence.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Samuel P Silver

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Samuel P Silver not in court.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  DEFENDANT IS DECEASED.
ANY FINE/FORFEITURES, COSTS, ASSESSMENTS AND SURCHARGES TO BE WAIVED.
ANY OUTSTANDING CIVIL JUDGMENTS, FINE & COST COMMITMENTS, SUSPENSIONS FOR DRIVING PRIVILEGES TO BE VACATED AND/OR WITHDRAWN.
Proof of death notification received from Credit Management on this date and forwarded to Court for review.
WITHDRAWAL OF APPEAL filed.
Withdrawal of Appeal filed by Atty. Lisa M. Procaccio.
Associated with Charge #1

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
AS TO COUNTS 1:
The Court ordered the Defendant to:
-Serve 9 months in the House of Correction, concurrent to any other sentence with credit for 79 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply`for AODA treatment.
-6 month drivers license suspension
AS TO COUNT 3:
The Court ordered the Defendant to:
-Serve 9 months in the House of Correction, concurrent to any other sentence with credit for 79 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply`for AODA treatment.
AS TO COUNT 4:
The Court ordered the Defendant to:
-Serve 6 months in the House of Correction, concurrent to any other sentence with credit for 79 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply`for AODA treatment.
The Court does not find the defendant eligible for expunction.
AS TO ALL COUNTS:
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid by 7/24/17; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay related surcharge by 7/24/17; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Restitution set at zero
-No contact with MM during the pendency of this sentence.
The Court makes the defendant eligible for the day reporting center, and takes no position on electronic monitoring.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Defense's motion for release on bail pending appeal is denied by the court.

Defendant Samuel P Silver in court with attorney Lisa M. Procaccio.  Defendant Samuel P Silver in custody.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
AS TO COUNTS 1, 3 & 4:
Defendant  advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms; also defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Sentencing memorandum filed by defense; received and filed.

Attorney Lisa M. Procaccio in court, defendant Samuel P Silver not in court, in custody.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Defense counsel is waiting to speak with ADA Chisholm regarding this case. Case rescheduled for PROJECTED PLEA on 7/23/2015 at 1:30 pm in Branch 15.
Received and Filed, Justice Point Discharge Summary Report.
Defendant advised No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.  Defendant to have no contact with M.M. or Sara Silver.
All other terms and conditions of bail remain the same.

Defendant Samuel P Silver in court with attorney Lisa M. Procaccio.  Defendant Samuel P Silver in custody.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin for Patricia Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requests Projected guilty plea.    Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 15.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 750.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Lisa M. Procaccio in court.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE.
Defendant appeared and left before the case was called.   Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.
  COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT. Court ordered signature bond forfeited.

Defendant Samuel P Silver in court with attorney Lisa M. Procaccio.David Behm for  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Defense just received discovery and an offer on todays date. Case calendared for STATUS on 5/21/2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.
Justice Point Report received and filed. sab
Defendant advised No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.

Defendant Samuel P Silver in court with attorney Lisa M. Procaccio. Hanna Kolberg for Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15.    Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with MM dob 11/12/1998 her residence and relatives or Co-Defendant Sara Silver and her residence.

Defendant Samuel P Silver in court with attorney Lisa M. Procaccio.  Defendant Samuel P Silver in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Count 4.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
